hint: Push selective filters (date, demographics, address) down into the joins early, and consider converting implicit joins to explicit joins for better predicate pushdown control.
Isolate highly selective dimension filters (date_dim, customer_demographics, household_demographics, customer_address) into CTEs or subqueries to reduce join cardinality early.
Materialize filtered subsets of all dimension tables and the fact table into separate CTEs, then join them in a star-optimized order to minimize intermediate result sizes.
Transform the OR condition in customer_demographics into a UNION, decompose joins to use EXISTS for selective dimensions, and restructure the query to avoid redundant scans.
